<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 194, 220, 208]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 215, 356, 231]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2 (P2)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 259, 460, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 195, 907, 210]]<|/det|>
9709/21  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 217, 907, 233]]<|/det|>
May/June 2013  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 240, 907, 255]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 322, 390, 338]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 351, 828, 367]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 368, 722, 383]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 384, 325, 399]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 400, 497, 416]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 416, 601, 432]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 447, 284, 462]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 463, 907, 494]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 494, 590, 509]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 510, 606, 525]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 540, 606, 555]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 556, 756, 571]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 572, 440, 587]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 588, 907, 619]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 918, 94]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(|2^{x} - 7| = 1\), giving answers correct to 2 decimal places where appropriate. [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 120, 97, 139]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 120, 920, 140]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\ln (3 - 2x) - 2\ln x = \ln 5.\) [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 166, 101, 185]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 166, 153, 185]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 166, 487, 186]]<|/det|>
Show that \(12\sin^{2}x\cos^{2}x\equiv \frac{3}{2}(1 - \cos 4x).\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 168, 920, 186]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 198, 153, 216]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 198, 295, 216]]<|/det|>
Hence show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[361, 217, 640, 257]]<|/det|>
\[\int_{\frac{1}{4}\pi}^{\frac{1}{3}\pi}12\sin^{2}x\cos^{2}x \mathrm{d}x = \frac{\pi}{8} +\frac{3\sqrt{3}}{16}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 230, 920, 248]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 293, 96, 312]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 293, 920, 329]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(a x^{3} - 5x^{2} + b x + 9\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants, is denoted by \(\mathrm{p}(x)\). It is given that \((2x + 3)\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\), and that when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((x + 1)\) the remainder is 8.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 339, 153, 358]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 339, 373, 358]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 341, 920, 359]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 370, 151, 388]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 370, 630, 389]]<|/det|>
When \(a\) and \(b\) have these values, factorise \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) completely.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 371, 920, 389]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 416, 97, 435]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 416, 437, 435]]<|/det|>
The parametric equations of a curve are

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 441, 576, 462]]<|/det|>
\[x = \mathrm{e}^{2t},\quad y = 4t\mathrm{e}^{t}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 484, 154, 504]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 483, 361, 510]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{2(t + 1)}{\mathrm{e}^{t}}.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 488, 920, 507]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 523, 153, 541]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 523, 707, 542]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the normal to the curve at the point where \(t = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 524, 920, 543]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 570, 97, 588]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 570, 165, 588]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[163, 570, 650, 588]]<|/det|>
By sketching a suitable pair of graphs, show that the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 594, 556, 613]]<|/det|>
\[\cot x = 4x - 2,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 621, 594, 640]]<|/det|>
where \(x\) is in radians, has only one root for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \frac{1}{2}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 622, 920, 641]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 653, 151, 672]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 653, 695, 672]]<|/det|>
Verify by calculation that this root lies between \(x = 0.7\) and \(x = 0.9\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 654, 920, 672]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 684, 151, 702]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 684, 520, 702]]<|/det|>
Show that this root also satisfies the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 707, 562, 742]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{1 + 2\tan x}{4\tan x}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 715, 920, 734]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 766, 151, 785]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 764, 920, 802]]<|/det|>
Use the iterative formula \(x_{n + 1} = \frac{1 + 2\tan x_{n}}{4\tan x_{n}}\) to determine this root correct to 2 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 791, 920, 810]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
(i) Express \(5 \sin 2\theta + 2 \cos 2\theta\) in the form \(R \sin (2\theta + \alpha)\), where \(R > 0\) and \(0^\circ < \alpha < 90^\circ\), giving the exact value of \(R\) and the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 2 decimal places. [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 175, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>Hence</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 152, 153, 170]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 151, 306, 170]]<|/det|>
solve the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 170, 591, 190]]<|/det|>
\[5\sin 2\theta +2\cos 2\theta = 4,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 194, 544, 214]]<|/det|>
giving all solutions in the interval \(0^{\circ}\leqslant \theta \leqslant 360^{\circ}\) ,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 197, 920, 215]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 233, 151, 250]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 227, 660, 256]]<|/det|>
determine the least value of \(\frac{1}{(10 \sin 2\theta + 4 \cos 2\theta)^2}\) as \(\theta\) varies.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 234, 920, 252]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 75, 564, 90]]<|/det|>
# BLANK PAGE
